com.fluidops.iwb.annotation
Class AnnotationProcessor

java.lang.Object
  com.fluidops.iwb.annotation.AnnotationProcessor

public class AnnotationProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

Annotation framework main class, providing public methods for extracting ontology and triples from OWL-annotated classes and objects, respectively.

Author:
msc

Field Detail

vf

public static final org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory vf

SHARED_CONTEXT_URI

public static final org.openrdf.model.URI SHARED_CONTEXT_URI
TODO: think about a strategy for the following problem: Currently, we have the problem that, when writing triples that are not directly associated to the object (such as, for instance, the triple (Linux,type,Application)), where Linux is directly attached to the object, we have no strategy to avoid duplicates. Therefore, we write all such triples to a shared context (where they will, however, not be deleted again - as we don't know where they come from anymore).

registerClass

public static void registerClass(java.lang.Class<?> c)
Registers the annotated class to be considered within the annotation framework. All classes have to be registered, in order to make the framework work properly.

Parameters:
c -

extractReferencingObjects

public static java.util.Map<com.fluidops.api.annotation.OWLProperty,java.util.Set<java.lang.Object>> extractReferencingObjects(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                                                                                               java.util.Map<com.fluidops.api.annotation.OWLProperty,com.fluidops.api.annotation.OWLAnnotationInfo.PropertyAndValueExtractor> updateReferencingObjectFieldsAndMethods)
Extracts referencing objects according to the specification passed in parameter updateReferencingObjectFieldsAndMethods. The results is a mapping from the @OWLProperty-annotation to sets of referencing objects.

Parameters:
newObj -
updateReferencingObjectFieldsAndMethods -
Returns:

Parameters:
